review: For the price, this is a really neat device. But it is not a fully finished product and I imagine more and more features are coming with updates. But to be able to stream netflix to the tv, and now hbo go, from tablet/phone is pretty cool.I am more curious about the casting of chrome pages to a large screen for presentations, and this functionality could use some improvement but the price is right and should only continue to become a better value.it needs to add plex casting next though..
author: Amazon Customer

review: Price is right. Does stream some content to my TV, and does a good job. Not sure what you'd use it for without a Netflix or HuluPlus account (assuming HuluPlus works with it, I haven't tried.) Has to be plugged in to power supply to work, and has a very bright blue LED that compels you to unplug it overnight. I could put tape over the light, but I've left it to remind me to unplug it overnight. Setup was fairly painless. It doesn't cost that many more dollars to buy a Roku or AppleTV, but you could also look at it this way: it costs about 1/3 as much as a Roku or AppleTV…
author: M. Frobisher

review: Stream Netflix movies and Youtube videos directly from your mobile device to your TV easily and effortlessly. Set-up is a breeze even for the technically challenged. PERFECT gift for geeks, grandparents, and anyone who'd like to view online video from the comfort of their couch on their widescreen television.
author: Seven007

review: This is the lowest cost and easiest device to use to access Netflix and other similar services on your flat screen TV. And it does more! Works great using your smartphone as a remote. I was previously using a Roku 3 and before that Apple TV. Would not go back. I recommend this to all my friends and on my todayspersonalcomputing web site.
